page.title: 01Ruford Abbey,Park and Farms
page.content: This area was once part of the fufford Abbey estate and is still dominated by the ruined abbey.The ruin and grounds belong now to the Nottinghamshire County coucil and are managed by their leisure sevices committee. This is now a Country Park and is being developed as a tourist attraction adjacent to Sherwood Forest. There is a lake,arboretum, ecuipture gardens, and in the old stable block, a craft centre, restaurant and gallery. to the south of the Abbey grounds is a residential development of about 40 houses. The rest of the area consists mainly of three abby farms which are now privately owned. they are largely arable and grow sugar beet and oil seed rape. There is also some pheasant shooting.
